section.para: A (BG) is a contract by which a third party (the guarantor, which here will be the bank) undertakes to be responsible for specific success and, in particular, to accept the damages which can result from a specific corporate transaction.
Based on this general definition, several specific types of guarantee can be handled. To name a few, the following ones are handled in as standard types of s:

listitem.para: a bid bond is given by a bidder for a construction contract to guarantee that the bidder, if awarded the contract within the time stipulated, will enter into the contract and furnish any performance and payment bonds that may be required.
a bond which guarantees performance of the terms of a written contract. Performance Bonds frequently, but not always, incorporate payment bond and maintenance bond liability.
a bond given by a contractor to guarantee payment to certain subcontractors, labourers and suppliers for the labour and material used in the work performed under the contract.

under the terms of a contract, a supplier may receive an advance of payment for the service provided. If he subsequently fails to deliver, this bond will ensure the reimbursement of that advanced amount to the buyer.
for each payment to be made by the Buyer, a certain portion is kept until the satisfying completion of the contracted work.

This document is the carnet referred to in the International Customs Convention on the A.T.A. Carnet for the Temporary Admission of Goods. It is an international document with which an importer posts security with the insurer of the carnet. The issuing body (often a national Chamber of Commerce) guarantees the payment of any duties and taxes if the condition of temporary importation is violated.

section.para: The life cycle of a guarantee generally starts with a request from the customer of the bank asking for issuance of a certain type of Guarantee. It may be followed by several forms of communication whose details vary from one type of guarantee to the other (including amendments of the guarantee's terms).

It generally ends with the submission to the bank of some details or documents implying the cancellation of the guarantee (e.g. The proof of completion of a contract under a Performance Bond), or the reach of its expiry date.

implements the applicant side of the customer-to-bank relationship. The bank involved is here considered as simply the recipient of the customer's request and potentially also the Issuing Bank of the guarantee.

This module enables you, on behalf of your company, to submit details of a new guarantee, request amendments to the terms of an existing guarantee, and engage in free format communications with the Recipient Bank and/or Issuing Bank concerning a guarantee.

note.para: For a BG that you have marked as provisional, the Bank may move it to either of the two statuses: 'Wording Under Review' or 'Final Wording'. Open the provisional BG and either 'Accept' or 'Reject' with your reasons and supporting file uploads. This negotiation of the terms of the BG by marking it provisional is the Client Wording feature. The provisional BG status remains 'Wording Under Review' till the Bank User changes it to 'Final Wording'. You can open and review the transaction with the status 'Final Wording' and either Accept or Reject it. Accepting it will give the choice to the Bank User to register the transaction, and rejecting it will provide the option for another cycle of negotiations based on your inputs. Once accepted by you, the Provisional BG moves from the Existing Records to the Pending Records > List of Records of the Bank User. From here, the Bank User can select the appropriate option for the BG from: Wording Under Review, Final Wording, Approved and Not Processed. You can find any Approved or Not Processed BG through the BG Inquiry menu with a detailed history of the transaction.

section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: BG Maintenance - Rejected BGs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
